author: Melissa J

review: Great little gadget for watching streaming Internet content on your tv. It hides behind my tv and i have a dedicated plug back therr too so no annoying wires showing. I no longer have to hook up my laptop, which was annoying, to the hdmi port on my tv. The roku works great and I haven't had any problems with lagging or choppyness like I do when I hook up my laptop. I have never had it lock up or needed to reboot it. It's easy to use and it's the only thing my 10 yr old grand daughter watches when she is here. I would recommend this to anyone who has a WWE subscription or a Netflix account. I bought is as a Christmas present for my husband and he has recommended to all his friends who watch WWE. One thing you might want to know is that the remote is rf instead of ir which means you don't have to point it at the tv to make it work. My grand daughter has sat on it many times and it is so sensitive, other that that I give it 5 stars for sure

review: Sadly, a good idea that it not yet a substitute for cable. Easy install, slow loading, awkward search format within the channels, commercials that you can't skip. Many channels are not properly organized for current episode viewing (dates are scrambled or they are badly edited clips). Okay for movies or TV, if you want to consolidate your Amazon Prime, Netflix Streaming and Hulu subscriptions. NOT for live news or sports. And, for delayed news or sports, NOT as good as streaming Internet and/or cable because of the poor channel delivery of shows. Returned, will try Chromecast next.
